page.title: 01Rhee Valley Sth. Arrington
page.content:
Heavy clay arable land divided by two salient features. Both running north to South. The A14 formerly great north Rd of Roman Origin -Ermine St and the Wimpole Hall Avenue formerly of Elm now of Lime Saplings. The A14 runs through the middle of the plot. All land to the east is part of the Wimpole Ham Estate and this is divided into two by the Great Double Avenue or trees.
The avenue is permanent grassland and leads up to Wimpole Hall, not in this block. Another Roman Road, Cambridge Road runs diagonally across the south easterly corner.
